title: Miri failure on `core::fmt::float::float_to_decimal_common_shortest::<f64>`
body:
The following program (which is awkwardly written to try to shrink the backtrace; just using `format!("{}", 0 as f64)` will trigger it)
```
use std::fmt;

fn main() {
    let x: f64 = 100.0;
    let mut s = String::new();
    fmt::write(&mut s, format_args!("{}", x));
}
```
fails under `cargo miri` on `nightly-2018-10-19` with
```
error[E0080]: constant evaluation error: type validation failed: encountered non-integer enum discriminant at [0]
   --> /home/apoelstra/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-2018-10-19-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/src/libcore/fmt/float.rs:42:45
    |
42  |         let mut parts: [flt2dec::Part; 4] = mem::uninitialized();
    |                                             ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
    |
   ::: /home/apoelstra/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-2018-10-19-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/src/libcore/mem.rs:600:2
    |
600 | }
    |  - type validation failed: encountered non-integer enum discriminant at [0]
    |
note: inside call to `core::fmt::float::float_to_decimal_common_shortest::<f64>`
   --> /home/apoelstra/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-2018-10-19-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/src/libcore/fmt/float.rs:65:9
    |
65  |         float_to_decimal_common_shortest(fmt, num, sign, min_precision)
    |         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
note: inside call to `core::fmt::float::float_to_decimal_common::<f64>`
   --> /home/apoelstra/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-2018-10-19-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/src/libcore/fmt/float.rs:136:17
    |
136 |                 float_to_decimal_common(fmt, self, false, 0)
    |                 ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
note: inside call to `core::fmt::float::<impl std::fmt::Display for f64>::fmt`
   --> /home/apoelstra/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-2018-10-19-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/src/libcore/fmt/mod.rs:1102:9
    |
1102|         (value.formatter)(value.value, self)
    |         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
note: inside call to `std::fmt::Formatter::run`
   --> /home/apoelstra/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-2018-10-19-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/src/libcore/fmt/mod.rs:1049:17
    |
1049|                 formatter.run(arg)?;
    |                 ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
note: inside call to `std::fmt::write`
   --> src/main.rs:7:5
    |
7   |     fmt::write(&mut s, format_args!("{}", x));
    |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
note: inside call to `main`
<snip>
```
I'm not sure if this is a bug in core or in miri, but it is preventing some unit tests of mine from running under miri.
